title: August 28
description:
It's good to be back in the Bay Area. We have quickly readjusted to life as we used to know it. France already seems a distant memory.

The house felt slightly off at first. Its denizens had moved furniture around, rearranged the cupboards in the kitchen and relegated some items to the garage (where, sadly, our bean bag chair and the kids' rug caught fatal cases of mold). Also, we had put a lot of stuff away in boxes. Now, things are back to where they belong. It feels like home again.

We are visiting friends, strolling through favorite neighborhoods and sampling all the food we missed (Semifreddi's Cinnamon Bread, burritos from Taqueria Cactus, and so many more!). Lucie is particularly happy to be reunited with her bike, her yoga studio and the YMCA's swimming pool. Felix and Milo can't get enough of their Lego Room and Rohai Dojo.

All is well in the world.

children.title: Torin
children.description:
Torin had a major growth spurt. She's even taller than Felix! Also, her hair's longer and she finally grew those missing front teeth.

Aside from that, she hasn't changed much. She's still our favorite red-headed girl.

children.title: Burns Sisters
children.description:
Kora, about to start middle school, looks like a pre-teen. Wow! Thankfully, she's not yet too old to get down and play with little boys.

The kids have made it their duty to play with every single one of their toys before school starts. Kora and Torin came over to give them a hand.

children.title: Rohai Dojo
children.description:
Kora, Torin, Felix and Milo spent a week at karate camp at Rohai Dojo. Our boys were SO excited to see their beloved Sensei John again and get back to their Cuong Nhu routine.

Felix was a little bummed to realize all the kids have gone up several belt levels during his European tour. He has some catching up to do.

children.title: Double Birthday
children.description: The July birthday boys finally got to blow their candles. Happy belated double birthday!

children.title: Enki
children.description: Some folks have been extra busy while we were away. Mikek and Liz had a baby! His name is Enki.

children.title: Enkisitting
children.description: Enki came to spend a few hours with us while his parents went on a date.

children.title: Enkisitting 2
children.description: Lucie and Milo hope that this is only the first visit of many by baby Enki. We need our baby fix!

children.title: Enkisobbing
children.description: I swear, he was smiling and doing adorable babbles two minutes before this photo was taken. I blew it by reaching for my camera.

children.title: Bikes
children.description:
Milo got a bicycle for his 7th birthday. It has gears and wheels large enough to allow for some real speed. This has transformed family biking; he can keep up with the rest of us!

We ride our bikes a lot: to playgrounds, dojo, summer camp, the Berkeley marina and (pictured here) our favorite pizza joint.

children.title: Pizza Gioia
children.description:
Pizza Gioia, we missed you! We ate some delicious pizza in Italy but never managed to find a decent pie in Les Lilas.

Not only is the pizza first class and the ambiance intensely neighborhoody, but also the cooks toss the dough in the air for one good spin before adding the toppings.

children.title: Jennifers
children.description: Jennifer L., Jennifer S. and baby Felix in Dolores Park.

children.title: Soren
children.description:
Soren shows off his cool tattoo (Keep Hope Alive).

We met Jennifer, Peter, Soren and Felix while they were living in Paris this year. It was odd we didn't know them before because we have a ton of mutual friends. They left Paris in June, are summering in San Francisco, and are about to move to Washington DC, where Soren will be attending a French school. Lucie was pleased to hear him talk French with her.

children.title: Lego Room
children.description: We own a simply ridiculous amount of Legos. The kids think it's just right. We hear the three boys who lived in our house last year made good use of them. Glad to hear it.

children.title: Owen & Ada
children.description:
Owen and family were high on our list of folks we couldn't wait to see again.

Where did Milo go for the group shot?

children.title: Feet
children.description:
There he is, hiding behind the curtain.

Sometimes, Milo hides from the camera.

children.title: Tiger
children.description:
Sometimes, Milo insits on us taking photos of him. Here, he wanted to make sure we got a good shot of his most excellent face paint.

This tigrification happened at Steve & Kate's Camp, a summer camp that had an end-of-summer fun day of epic proportions. It included a bouncy castle, cream pie throwing, real-life game shows with a multitude of prizes.

The kids had a blast for the two days they went. Unfortunately, Felix got his first real sunburn of the summer. :(

children.title: Lego Star Wars
children.description: Lego Star Wars on the Playstation while the aloe dries on Felix's sunburned neck.

children.title: MermAda
children.description:
For her 5th birthday, Ada asked her guests to come in costume. Dean came as himself 6 weeks ago.

As we were getting on our bikes to pedal to the party, Felix turned to Dean with a worried expression "Papa, you aren't wearing your kilt like a real Scotsman, are you? I think you should wear underwear."

children.title: Graffiti
children.description:
All during the year in France, the kids were itching to do some graffiti. We explained we couldn't do it on someone else's walls but could once we got home.

We're nervous about turning them loose on actual real estate, but we did tack up paper on the garage door and have some fun with spray paint.

children.title: Garage Door
children.description: We divided the paper in quadrants. One for each family member.

children.title: Spray Paint
children.description: We are already planning our next piece. We have decided we need to make some stencils.

children.title: Mo' Moses
children.description: Working on our street artist attitude.
